listitem.para: If set, the NFLOG group number to log all pre-crypt and post-decrypt traffic to. The default value of 0 means no logging at all. This option is only available on linux kernel 2.6.14 and later. It allows common network utilities such as tcpdump, wireshark and dumpcap, to use nflog:XXX pseudo interfaces where XXX is the nflog group number. During startup and shutdown of the IPsec service, iptables commands will be used to add or remove the global NFLOG table rules. The rules are setup with the nflog-prefix all-ipsec. See also the per-connection nflog option.
